Ibu, empat anak rentung
06 Nov 2019, 07:00 by Agensi
Mexico City: Tiga wanita dan enam anak mereka, termasuk dua bayi kembar berusia enam bulan mati ditembak sekumpulan lelaki bersenjata ketika dalam perjalanan ke majlis perkahwinan di sempadan Mexico-Amerika Syarikat kelmarin.
Paling menyayat hati, Rhonita Maria LeBaron bersama bayi kembarnya berusia enam bulan dan dua lagi anaknya berusia lapan dan 10 tahun, terbakar hidup-hidup dalam van dinaiki mereka yang ditembak bertubi-tubi.
Daily Mail melaporkan, Rhonita memandu van berkenaan manakala dua lagi kereta dinaiki Christina Langford Johnson bersama anak perempuannya berusia tujuh bulan dan Dawna Langford bersama enam anaknya.


RHONITA bersama suami dan dua kembarnya, Tiana dan Titus, enam bulan serta dua lagi anaknya, Howard Jacob, 12, dan Krystal, 10, yang terbunuh.

Mayat dua ibu itu dan dua anak Dawna ditemui tidak jauh dari lokasi serangan. Seorang lagi anak perempuan Dawna berusia tujuh bulan ditemui masih hidup, terbaring di bawah tempat duduk belakang.
Menurut AFP, Julian Lebaron iaitu sepupu Rhonita Maria berkata, ahli keluarga mereka menemui kereta mangsa yang terbakar dengan mayat mangsa di dalam kenderaan itu.
Dua lagi kenderaan ditemui beberapa jam kemudian, mengandungi mayat dua lagi wanita (Christina dan Dawna) serta dua kanak-kanak.
Sekurang-kurangnya lima kanak-kanak, termasuk seorang yang cedera ditembak berjaya menyelamatkan diri berjalan pulang ke rumah.
Seorang lagi ahli keluarga mangsa memberitahu, 15 anggota keluarga masih hilang dalam serangan berkenaan, dipercayai dilakukan anggota sindiket pengedar dadah.
Mangsa ialah ahli keluarga LeBaron, masyarakat Mormon yang melarikan diri dari Amerika ke utara Mexico pada abad ke-19 selepas didakwa kerana tradisi mereka, termasuk poligami.
Ramai masyarakat Mormon di Mexico mempunyai dua kerakyatan, Mexico dan Amerika.
Keluarga itu tidak menolak kemungkinan serangan itu akibat kesilapan identiti.

Mom, four children
06 Nov 2019, 07:00 by Agency
Mexico City: Three women and six children, including two six-month-old twin babies, were shot dead by a group of armed men on their way to a wedding on the Mexico-United States border on Tuesday.
Most heartily, Rhonita Maria LeBaron, along with her six-month-old twin and two other children, aged eight and 10, were burnt alive in their van, shot dead.
The Daily Mail reported that Rhonita was driving the van while two other cars were in the Christina Langford Johnson with her seven-month-old daughter and Dawna Langford with her six children.


RHONITA with her husband and two twins, Tiana and Titus, six months and two of her children, Howard Jacob, 12, and Krystal, 10, were killed.

The bodies of the two mothers and two of Dawna's children were found not far from the scene of the attack. Another seven-month-old Dawna's daughter was found alive, lying under the back seat.
According to AFP, Julian Lebaron's cousin Rhonita Maria said their family found the victim's car burning with the body of the victim in the vehicle.
Two more vehicles were found hours later, containing the bodies of two other women (Christina and Dawna) and two children.
At least five children, including one who was shot to death, managed to escape home.
Another family member said 15 family members were still missing in the attack, believed to be members of a drug trafficking syndicate.
The victim was a member of the LeBaron family, a Mormon community that fled from North America to Mexico in the 19th century after being indicted for their traditions, including polygamy.
Many Mormons in Mexico have two nationalities, Mexican and American.
The family did not rule out the possibility of the attack because of an identity error.
